TopicTitle: So I want to go back in time...

Articles.Content:
And I want to have a Delorean DMC-12 with 1,21 GW of power to do it

More seriously, I know I have to go in the persistent.sfs file and change a line of code. Is that one?

FLIGHTSTATE

{

version = 0.23.0

UT = 17517503.8502323

activeVessel = 0

If the UT is in seconds, and I want to go back 30 days, do I have to do 17 517 503.8502323 - (3600sec/hour * 24hour/day * 30days) = 2 592 000.8502323, the result being the new UT?

Edited February 9, 2014 by rocket11

It is measured in seconds, HOWEVER: it will not bring back any flights that have ended since that time (so if you screwed up and your flight is lost it's gone for good) It will however reset the positions of all flights currently in progress based on their orbital parameters.
